title: InDesign CS2 / Block of colour behind paragraphs of text
content:
Hi,  
Can anyone help with how I can put a varying thickness of line that follows the text behind and be able to change the text colour and see it? I have done this before and I thought it was with strikethrough but I can't seem to get it so that the text colour is above the line? Sorry, I hope this is clear. Here is an example of what I am after...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018055232im_/http:/typophile.com/files/paragraph_5779.png)
author: Seadreams

comments.content: Underline the text and then adjust the line thickness and its location (character palette/underline options)

It is in dutch, but there is a helpful tutorial:  
 [http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=26](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018055232/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=26 "http://www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=26")  
(Paragraph rules)

T.
Thanks Mili. I just discovered that :-/... Cheers
